text: Lasha Torgvaidze (Georgian: ლაშა თორღვაიძე; born 26 May 1993) is a Georgian athlete specialising in the triple jump. He represented his country at the 2016 Summer Olympics without having a recording mark in the qualification round. His personal bests in the event are 16.87 metres outdoors (+0.9 m/s, Almaty 2016) and 16.62 metres indoors (Tbilisi 2016). ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2011 |European Youth Olympic Festival |Trabzon, Turkey |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Triple jump |15.49 m |- |2012 |World Junior Championships |Barcelona, Spain |6th |Triple jump |16.00 m |- |2013 |European Indoor Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |20th (q) |Triple jump |15.35 m |- |rowspan=2|2015 |European Indoor Championships |Prague, Czech Republic |15th (q) |Triple jump |15.97 m |- |European U23 Championships |Tallinn, Estonia |4th |Triple jump |16.33 m |- |rowspan=2|2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |16th (q) |Triple jump |16.32 m |- |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil | – |Triple jump |NM |- |2018 |European Championships |Berlin, Germany | – |Triple jump |NM |} ==References== Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Male triple jumpers from Georgia (country) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 European Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Georgia (country) Category:Olympic male triple jumpers Category:European Games competitors for Georgia (country)
title: Lasha Torgvaidze
